name: Smar Jbeil Citadel
description: Hill-top stone fortress dating back to Phoenician times, offering 360° views of coast & mountains.
copy: Hill-top stone fortress dating back to Phoenician times, offering 360° views of coast & mountains. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: Saint Nohra Church
description: Maronite church built on Roman temple foundations; famed for ancient stone façade.
copy: The Church of St. Nohra, one of the oldest in the Levant, dates back to the 3rd century and is dedicated to St. Nohra (or St. Logius), a martyr said to have been executed in a nearby fortress. First mentioned in a medieval Bible manuscript housed in Florence's Medici Library, the church was built in stages, using stones from former pagan temples. Revered as the patron saint of eyesight, St. Nohra made the church a major pilgrimage site for those seeking healing.

name: Saydet El Maounet Church (Oldest Virgin Mary Church)
description: Tiny one-nave chapel older than Saint Nohra, prized for faded 9th-century wall fresco of the Virgin.
copy: Tiny one-nave chapel older than Saint Nohra, prized for faded 9th-century wall fresco of the Virgin. Step inside to admire hand‑cut stone walls and luminous iconography; serenity seekers are welcome to light a candle.

name: Atibaia Winery tasting room
description: Boutique vineyard planted on 17th-century terraced slopes; offers guided cellar tours & organic wines.
copy: Boutique vineyard planted on 17th-century terraced slopes; offers guided cellar tours & organic wines. Book a tasting ahead to sample estate blends paired with foraged mezze in a shaded stone courtyard.

name: Smar Jbeil – Sainte Rafqa – Wadi Harba Hike
description: 10 km moderate hike linking the fortress to Sainte Rafqa shrine and down Wadi Harba canyon.
copy: 10 km moderate hike linking the fortress to Sainte Rafqa shrine and down Wadi Harba canyon.

name: Saint Rafqa Monastery, Jrabta
description: Pilgrimage site housing the tomb of Saint Rafqa; tranquil gardens & small museum.
copy: Pilgrimage site housing the tomb of Saint Rafqa; tranquil gardens & small museum. Step inside to admire hand‑cut stone walls and luminous iconography; serenity seekers are welcome to light a candle.

name: Rachana Sculpture Park & Basbous Museum
description: UNESCO-listed open-air museum of modern stone sculptures created by the Basbous brothers.
copy: UNESCO-listed open-air museum of modern stone sculptures created by the Basbous brothers. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: Mseilha Fort
description: Strategic medieval fortification perched atop a narrow limestone rock, overlooking a river valley.
copy: An iconic medieval fort built by Emir Fakhreddine in the 17th century, Mseilha Fort towers above a serene valley. Its dramatic clifftop setting and panoramic views make it a must-visit for history buffs and photographers alike.

name: Darb Mseilha Trail
description: Scenic pedestrian walkway along a riverbank leading to the historic Mseilha Fort.
copy: Follow this scenic stone-paved trail through lush greenery and gentle streams, ending at the dramatic cliffside Mseilha Fort. A peaceful blend of nature, heritage, and breathtaking photo ops—perfect for golden hour walks.

name: Batroun Old Souk
description: Renovated 19th-century marketplace packed with cafés, pubs, artisan shops & lemonade stalls.
copy: Renovated 19th-century marketplace packed with cafés, pubs, artisan shops & lemonade stalls. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: St. Stephan’s Cathedral
description: 19th-century sandstone Maronite cathedral overlooking the harbour; free to enter.
copy: 19th-century sandstone Maronite cathedral overlooking the harbour; free to enter. Step inside to admire hand‑cut stone walls and luminous iconography; serenity seekers are welcome to light a candle.

name: Phoenician Wall & Ancient Port
description: 3rd-century BCE sea wall built by the Phoenicians; perfect spot for tidal-pool swims.
copy: 3rd-century BCE sea wall built by the Phoenicians; perfect spot for tidal-pool swims. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: Fisherman Harbor Sunset Point
description: Colourful fishing boats framed by golden-hour light; best spot for sunset photography.
copy: Colourful fishing boats framed by golden-hour light; best spot for sunset photography. Expect crystal‑clear water, casual beach bars for sundowners, and lifeguards during summer weekends.

name: Batroun Public Beach
description: Free sandy strip with calm shallows, beach volleyball and lifeguards (summer).
copy: Free sandy strip with calm shallows, beach volleyball and lifeguards (summer). Expect crystal‑clear water, casual beach bars for sundowners, and lifeguards during summer weekends.

name: White Beach Resort
description: Family-friendly private cove with white-pebble shore, cabanas & Mediterranean fusion restaurant.
copy: Family-friendly private cove with white-pebble shore, cabanas & Mediterranean fusion restaurant. Expect crystal‑clear water, casual beach bars for sundowners, and lifeguards during summer weekends.

name: Orchid Beach Lounge
description: Adults-only beach club with infinity pools, daybeds & live DJ sets.
copy: Adults-only beach club with infinity pools, daybeds & live DJ sets. Expect crystal‑clear water, casual beach bars for sundowners, and lifeguards during summer weekends.

name: Pierre & Friends Surf Shack
description: Iconic beach bar known for weekend parties, surfboard rentals & coastal cliff diving.
copy: Iconic beach bar known for weekend parties, surfboard rentals & coastal cliff diving. Expect crystal‑clear water, casual beach bars for sundowners, and lifeguards during summer weekends.

name: Colonel Brewery & Distillery
description: Eco-friendly craft brewery offering tours, tastings, live music & on-site camping.
copy: Eco-friendly craft brewery offering tours, tastings, live music & on-site camping. Book a tasting ahead to sample estate blends paired with foraged mezze in a shaded stone courtyard.

name: IXSIR Winery (Basbina)
description: Award-winning sustainable winery built beneath a 17th-century manor; rooftop farm-to-table bistro.
copy: Award-winning sustainable winery built beneath a 17th-century manor; rooftop farm-to-table bistro. Book a tasting ahead to sample estate blends paired with foraged mezze in a shaded stone courtyard.

name: Batroun Mountains Winery
description: Family-run high-altitude vineyards spanning 400–1500 m; panoramic tastings & jeep tours.
copy: Family-run high-altitude vineyards spanning 400–1500 m; panoramic tastings & jeep tours. Book a tasting ahead to sample estate blends paired with foraged mezze in a shaded stone courtyard.

name: Sept Winery & Taproom (Amchit)
description: Organic natural-wine pioneer offering cellar walks and sea-view picnics.
copy: Organic natural-wine pioneer offering cellar walks and sea-view picnics. Book a tasting ahead to sample estate blends paired with foraged mezze in a shaded stone courtyard.

name: PureTech Diving Center
description: PADI 5-Star dive school running boat dives to submarine canyons & underwater caves.
copy: PADI 5-Star dive school running boat dives to submarine canyons & underwater caves. Equipment rental and certified instructors are available year‑round; visibility peaks June‑September.

name: Nahr El Joz Riverside Trail
description: Shaded 8 km path following crystal river, picnic spots & historic watermills.
copy: Shaded 8 km path following crystal river, picnic spots & historic watermills. Way‑finding signs are clear and benches dot the route, making this a relaxed outing for families and nature lovers.

name: Kfarhelda Waterfall
description: 25-metre cascade plunging into natural pool; best flow in spring.
copy: 25-metre cascade plunging into natural pool; best flow in spring. Way‑finding signs are clear and benches dot the route, making this a relaxed outing for families and nature lovers.

name: Arnaoon Village Experience Park
description: 300-year-old hilltop estate turned into family adventure hub with zip-lines, archery & Lebanese buffet.
copy: 300-year-old hilltop estate turned into family adventure hub with zip-lines, archery & Lebanese buffet. On‑site staff run a full calendar of workshops and seasonal festivals; kids’ activities run weekends.

name: Tannourine Cedars Forest Nature Reserve
description: 625 ha reserve protecting Lebanon’s densest cedar grove; six marked hiking loops.
copy: 625 ha reserve protecting Lebanon’s densest cedar grove; six marked hiking loops. Way‑finding signs are clear and benches dot the route, making this a relaxed outing for families and nature lovers.

name: Bchaaleh ‘Sisters’ Olive Trees
description: 12 legendary olive trees believed to be 6,000 years old, still bearing fruit.
copy: 12 legendary olive trees believed to be 6,000 years old, still bearing fruit. Way‑finding signs are clear and benches dot the route, making this a relaxed outing for families and nature lovers.

name: Douma Heritage Walk
description: Charming red-roof village with preserved 19th-century Lebanese architecture & artisanal mouneh shops.
copy: Charming red-roof village with preserved 19th-century Lebanese architecture & artisanal mouneh shops. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: Assia Traditional Pottery Workshop
description: Hands-on class crafting clay cooking pots using millennia-old techniques preserved by local women.
copy: Hands-on class crafting clay cooking pots using millennia-old techniques preserved by local women. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.

name: Cycling the Batroun Coastal Road
description: Scenic 15 km bike lane hugging cliffs & hidden coves; rentals available in old souk.
copy: Scenic 15 km bike lane hugging cliffs & hidden coves; rentals available in old souk.

name: Surf Lessons at Colonel Reef
description: ISA-certified instructors offering beginner surf & SUP sessions at sheltered reef break.
copy: ISA-certified instructors offering beginner surf & SUP sessions at sheltered reef break.

name: Byblos Old Port & Citadel
description: UNESCO-listed Phoenician port, Crusader castle, mosaic-paved souk & seafood restaurants.
copy: UNESCO-listed Phoenician port, Crusader castle, mosaic-paved souk & seafood restaurants. Guided tours spotlight centuries of layered history and offer sweeping coastal panoramas—an Instagram favourite.
